intro: Heptapleurum mannii, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically in the axils of the leaves. Heptapleurum mannii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
